comments.body: @whitlockjc For the future, please try to separate autogenerated changes into a separate commit - it's much easier to review then.

Are we sure this is advisable?  If you run `./hack/update-all.sh` as suggested in the [documentation](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/adding-an-APIGroup.md), this is created.  Also, for new people it would be hard to distinguish between the different _types_ of autogenerated code, like bazel vs. codecgen vs. protobuf vs. openapi/swagger.  Following the documentation has all of these resources being created.
Yeah - as @smarterclayton wrote - you don't need to split it by type. It's fine to have all auto-generated things in a single commit.
